meanings.definition: A type of polysaccharide extracted from red seaweed.
meanings.sent1: The chef used carrageenins to thicken the soup.
meanings.sent2: Food companies often add carrageenins to improve the texture of products.
meanings.sent3: The carrageenins in the pudding made it so thick, it bounced off the plate!
meanings.sent4: Her love for cooking was like carrageenins, always adding substance to her life.
meanings.sent5: The red seaweed's carrageenins were as sticky as glue, holding everything together.

meanings.definition: Substances used as thickening or stabilizing agents in food products.
meanings.sent1: Carrageenins are commonly found in dairy alternatives.
meanings.sent2: When making ice cream, carrageenins help maintain a creamy texture.
meanings.sent3: The carrageenins at the food factory went on strike for better working conditions!
meanings.sent4: In the kitchen of life, friendships are the carrageenins that keep everything stable.
meanings.sent5: The chef's secret ingredient, carrageenins, transformed the dish into a masterpiece.
